title: Beyond the daydream
excerpt: I tend to come up with lots of plans.

children.text: I tend to come up with lots of plans.
So much so, that I’m often swamped. Torn between dozens of potential futures.
Perhaps that’s why plans ought to be detailed. Not merely sketched out.
You should write them down in clearest detail, to the exact people you need to reach, or the things you need to get, or the errands you need done.
By making plans vivid, you can learn to appreciate all that you need to do to have the things you say you want.
And to narrow it down enough to choose to focus on just one.
